history.content: You can schedule an appointment with a CS advisor on your CalCentral page under My Academics and then under the Advising section. The rule in L&S is that you can only have two overlaps for all three majors.

children.subject: I think it would be all 3 majors sharing the same 2 classes.

+1, i believe this is the case. you can only have 2 classes total serve as upper div credit for 2 or more majors. so if you had one class which gives credit for CS and data and another which gives credit for data and business, that's all you get.

What does 2 overlap in all 3 majors mean?

I need to 2 classes for electives in Haas which satisfy Business Domain Emphasis in DS Major.

And I have 2 overlaps between CS and data science because I have taken probability already for CS and need CS 182 for design requirement in CS and that satisfies Modelling requirement in DS.

history.content:
Hey,

I am planning to declare Data Science as a Major as well and was wondering how the overlapping of courses works in the case of 3 majors. My 3 majors would be CS, Data Science, and Business. 
I want my Data Science Domain Emphasis to be business and Industrial Analytics.

As far as I know, you can have 2 Upper-division courses overlap between 2 majors.

So I can have 2 classes overlap between Data Science and Business, 2 overlaps between Data Science and Computer Science, and 2 overlaps between Computer Science and Business as long as the overlapping classes are mutually exclusive?

How can I schedule a 1 on 1 call to discuss this in further detail with some advisor?
history.subject: How does Upper division overlapping of classes work in case of 3 majors?
